    • Method Detail

      • getSlotType

        InventoryGUI.SlotType getSlotType(int slot)

      • setSlotType

        void setSlotType(int slot,
               InventoryGUI.SlotType type)

      • addGadget

        void addGadget(ClickableGadget gadget)
        Add a clickable gadget to this GUI. The gadget will define its position in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        gadget - the gadget to add

      • getGadget

        ClickableGadget getGadget(int slot)
        Get the clickable gadget in the given slot.
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot to check
        Returns:
        the clickable gadget, or null if there is no gadget there

      • addLabel

        void addLabel(String label,
            int slot,
            ItemStack texture,
            String... lore)
        Add an informational label to this GUI.

        If a null texture is passed, a default texture defined in the SensibleToolbox plugin configuration ("gui.texture.label") is used.

        Parameters:
        label - the label text
        slot - the inventory slot to place the label in
        texture - the texture for the label, may be null
        lore - the label tooltip; extended information can be defined here

      • addMonitor

        int addMonitor(MonitorGadget gadget)
        Add a monitor gadget to this GUI. The gadget defines its own position in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        gadget - the gadget to add
        Returns:
        a unique integer identifying the monitor gadget

      • getMonitor

        MonitorGadget getMonitor(int monitorId)
        Get the monitor gadget for the given ID.
        Parameters:
        monitorId - a unique identifier, as returned by addMonitor(MonitorGadget)
        Returns:
        a monitor gadget, or null if no such gadget exists

      • getItem

        ItemStack getItem(int slot)
        Get the item in the given inventory slot. The slot must have previously been marked as an item slot with setSlotType(int, me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.gui.InventoryGUI.SlotType)
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot to check
        Returns:
        the item in that slot, may be null

      • setItem

        void setItem(int slot,
           ItemStack stack)
        Change the item in the given inventory slot. The slot must have previously been marked as an item slot with setSlotType(int, me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.gui.InventoryGUI.SlotType)
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot to update
        stack - the new item to place in the slot

      • getOwningBlock

        BaseSTBBlock getOwningBlock()
        Get the STB block which owns this GUI.
        Returns:
        the owning STB block
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the owner is not an STB block

      • getOwningItem

        BaseSTBItem getOwningItem()
        Get the STB item which owns this GUI.
        Returns:
        the owning STB item
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the owner is not an STB item

      • getInventory

        Inventory getInventory()
        Get the Bukkit inventory backing this GUI. Care should be taken when working with the raw inventory.
        Returns:
        the Bukkit inventory

      • show

        void show(Player player)
        Show this GUI to the given player.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to show the GUI to

      • hide

        void hide(Player player)
        Hide this GUI from the given player (pop it down)
        Parameters:
        player - the player to hide the GUI from

      • getViewers

        List<HumanEntity> getViewers()
        Get a list of players who currently have this GUI open.
        Returns:
        a list of HumanEntity

      • paintSlotSurround

        void paintSlotSurround(int[] slots,
                     ItemStack texture)
        Paint the slots surrounding the given list of slots.
        Parameters:
        slots - an array of slots
        texture - an item stack to use as a slot texture

      • paintSlot

        void paintSlot(int slot,
             ItemStack texture,
             boolean overwrite)
        Paint a slot in the GUI with the given texture.
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot to paint
        texture - an item stack to use as a slot texture
        overwrite - if false, don't paint the slot unless it's empty

      • freezeSlots

        String freezeSlots(int... slots)
        Freeze any items in the given slots into a string representation. This can later be passed to thawSlots(String, int...).
        Parameters:
        slots - an array of slots to freeze
        Returns:
        a string representation of the items in the given slots

      • thawSlots

        void thawSlots(String frozen,
             int... slots)
        Thaw a frozen item representation into the given slots. This frozen representation would have been created by freezeSlots(int...)
        Parameters:
        frozen - a frozen string representing some items
        slots - the slots to thaw those items into

      • ejectItems

        void ejectItems(int... slots)
        Eject any items in the given slots, dropping them on the ground at or near the GUI's owning block or player.
        Parameters:
        slots - the slots to eject items from
